document_data.name: Calim Desert
document_data.mainbody: The '''Calim Desert''', also known as the '''Skyfire Wastes''', was a rocky desert on the coast in the country of [[Calimshan]]. It was not formed by natural means, instead being the result of an epic magical war between two [[genie]]s, the [[djinni]] [[Calim]] and [[efreeti]] [[Memnon (efreeti)|Memnon]]. The sands hid the ruins of ancient cities, which were said to hold many treasures.

Geography.Geographical Features: The Calim Desert was primarily a level and rocky [[Wikipedia:en:Salt pan|salt flat]], yet the magical effects of Calim and Memnon could change that. These often dangerous manifestations of the two genies were called [[Calim#Description|"Calim's Breath"]] and [[Memnon (efreeti)#Description|"Memnon's Crackle"]]. The former was the cause of frequent sandstorms and whirlwinds; the latter the cause of earthquakes or the creation of patches of hot sand. The highly-porous [[worm rock]] could be found around the Calim Desert.{{Cite organized play/LFR/Heart of the Desert: Race Against Time|18}}
Geography.Flora and Fauna:
Small rodents and reptiles were a few of the animals who had adapted to life in this desert. Most lived among the ruins of ancient cities. Also numerous were arachnids and insects, rabbits, weasels, toads, and vultures.

The largest creatures lived below the sands; desert [[purple worm]]s frequented the area, and unlike typical purple worms, they lived in groups.

The [[Calim cactus]] was one of the few plants able to adapt to the changing and dry surface of the Calim desert. These strange plants were the primary food source for many of the animals listed above.

document_data.Trade and Travel:
The [[Trade Way]] cut directly across the Calim Desert from [[Calimport]] to [[Memnon]].

One could also travel around the desert along the [[Coast Trail]], but this was neither safe nor well-traveled.

By [[1370 DR]], the [[Twisted Rune]] had placed a magical gate in the desert to allow for instantaneous movement to other locations.
document_data.History:
In long ages past, the lands that later became the Calim Desert were lush farmland, a portion of which were known as the [[Teshyllal Fields]]. The cities of [[Dashadjen]] and [[Teshyll]] were located here during the [[Calim Empire]].

The desert's creation began in {{Yearlink|-6100}}, when the [[elf|elven]] [[high mage]] [[Pharos]] trapped the bodies of Calim and Memnon in the [[Calimemnon Crystal]]. Since that time, their consciousnesses had continued to war against each other, and their magical manifestations in the air and in the ground formed and maintained the desert.

It was estimated that if Calim and Memnon were ever released—which did in fact occur during the [[Spellplague]]—the desert would take 800 to 1,000 years to return to the terrain it once was.

In the {{YearlinkName|1450}}, the desert was frozen over for months while vassals of [[Auril]] fought against the efreet and genies of Calimshan.{{Cite dragon/367/Hall of the Frostmaiden|61}}
document_data.Legends: Every year on [[Ches 4]], locals claimed that the night winds howled with the sound of the hundreds of trapped genies within the Calimemnon Crystal, as that day was the anniversary of their entrapment.

Notable Locations.[[Amkethran]]: A small monastery and settlement home to [[Balthazar]] that was pivotal in the final days of the [[Bhaalspawn crisis]].
Notable Locations.[[Calimban Knoll]]: 25 miles south of Memnon, this was the site where a group of escaped slaves held off a legion of [[Calishite]] soldiers.
Notable Locations.[[Caverns of the Serpent Mother]]: This hidden lair of the [[Sacred Order of Akabar]] was located about twelve miles from Calimport.
Notable Locations.[[Calimport]]: The capital of Calimshan was located on the southeastern border of the desert.
Notable Locations.[[Cyric's Hammer]]: A towering five-hundred-foot rock with a wide, overhanging flat head, overlooking the main road from Calimport to Memnon. According to rumors, a hundred men died trying to climb it, the stones treacherously shifting near the summit. A wandering sage then proclaimed that the spire was accursed by [[Cyric]]. However, desert raiders were known to scale it with the help of ropes, using a single safe pass, making the legend dubious.
Notable Locations.Ruins of [[Dashadjen]]: West of the Trade Way and the [[Friary of St. Amahl]], this was the ruins of a garrison city of the Calim Empire. The [[Altar of the Air]] still stood here millennia later.
Notable Locations.[[Endurance Rock]]: This was a site within the Teshyllal Wastes holy to the [[Janessar]].
Notable Locations.The [[Friary of St. Amahl]]: This [[Ilmatari]] [[monastery]] was dedicated to the saint of nomads. It was located between the ruins of Dashadjen and the Trade Way.
Notable Locations.[[House of St. Liwan's Blessings]]: This Ilmatari monastery and cooking school was located off the Coast Trail between [[Teshburl]] and Memnon.
Notable Locations.[[Memnon]]: This ancient port city was located on the northern border of the desert.
Notable Locations.The [[Oasis of Calimstone]]: This oasis located in the eastern heart of the desert held the hoard of the blue dragon [[Thoklastees]]. It was discovered by the [[Dun Blades]] in [[1144 DR]].
Notable Locations.[[St. Noradnar's Hermitage]]: This Ilmatari monastery and fighting school was located off the Coast Trail between Calimport and Teshburl.
Notable Locations.The [[Spinning Keep of Siri'wadjen]]: This was the magical floating fortress surrounding the Calimemnon Crystal that held the "Trapped Terrors".
Notable Locations.[[Teshburl]]: This port town was located on the southwestern corner of the desert.
Notable Locations.Ruins of [[Teshyll]]: East of the Trade Way, in the Teshyllal Wastes, this was the ruins of a city from the Calim Empire that was the site of the architectural marvel, the [[Harem Palace]] of Calim.
Notable Locations.The [[Teshyllal Wastes]]: The central region of the Calim Desert, this area used to be fertile plains.
Notable Locations.The [[Tomb of the Astronomer]]: This was the tomb of an [[air genasi]] woman known only as the "Astronomer" who refused to take sides in the war between the Calim Empire and [[Memnonnar (country)|Memnonnar]] and instead focused on studying what she called the "[[Elemental Tempest]]". Since she would not serve Calim, he buried her and her compound alive in a sandstorm that lasted ten years.{{Cite dragon/360/Realmslore: Tomb of the Astronomer}}
Notable Locations.The [[Walking Oasis]]: This mysterious oasis had been appearing and disappearing on a seeming journey from the center of the desert to the southeast toward Teshburl.

Notable Inhabitants.Desert raiders: Dozens of nomadic raiding groups resided in the desert. One of these groups sheltered the one who would later become the Pretender Prince [[Yusuf Jhannivvar]], who sought to claim the throne of [[Tethyr]] in [[1368 DR]]. In [[1370 DR]], the [[Ralan el Pesarkhal|syl-pasha]] gave orders to his military to seek out and annihilate these nomadic peoples.
Notable Inhabitants.The [[Firestorm Cabal]]: This secret order of [[genasi]] had one of its keeps hidden on the southwestern coast.
Notable Inhabitants.[[El Sadhara]]: This [[mummy]] [[Cleric|priestess]] of [[Akadi]] resided in the Altar of the Air in Dashadjen, waiting for Calim's return.
Notable Inhabitants.[[Sapphiraktar]]: This [[Dragon aging|ancient]] male [[Blue dragon|blue]] [[dracolich]] had his immense lair below the Calim Desert and beyond.
Notable Inhabitants.[[Harssaf]]s: These creatures of fire and sand were once servants and warriors for the Great Pasha [[Memnon (efreeti)|Memnon]]. They survived the millennia since Memnon's binding confined to the Calim Desert.
